txt.en: Solved the riddle of the ship
You have found another of Falgeirr Twisttongue's plaques at Anaz창rmekhem in the Flaming Deeps.

A riddle, written in Falgeirr's strange runic language:

Weight in my belly,
Trees are my back,
Nails in my ribs,
Feet do I lack.

The solution  to Twisttongue's riddle can likely be found somewhere in the Flaming Deeps.

You have found another of Twisttongue's riddles:
 
Weight in my belly,
Trees are my back,
Nails in my ribs,
Feet do I lack.
'So, the answer to the riddle was a ship. I suppose that makes sense, now that I think of it. You are a clever one.\n\n'Now, let me take a look at what this next one says and study it a moment.'
Gapi is in Anaz창rmekhem, north-east of Bhraf-ru.\n\nGapi will be able to help you translate the next riddle.
'If I knew the answer, don't you think I would be onto the next one already?'
'So, the answer to the riddle was a boat. I suppose that makes sense, now that I think of it. You are a clever one. Now, let me take a look at what this next one says and study it a moment.'
